job_title: Claims Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Caring and concerned about staff
cons: Low pay but overtime available

job_title: Program Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good work life balance, with continued flexibility around remote work. Working for a great cause!
cons: Promotion paths are unclear and pay is significantly lower than market value.

review_title: Great place for steady in demand work
job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Remote work since Covid. Paid health care , and vacation time. You don't take your work home with you. Once you clock out you are done.
cons: Moving from customer service department to other departments may be difficult and take a long time. Albite to get raises may need to be revamped.

job_title: Inpatient Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Remote work due to Covid
Excellent coworkers- Best thing in the company
cons:
No opportunity to grow 
Work is added on but no raise in salary 
Micromanaging
Passive Aggressive environment
It took a friend more than 5 years to get promoted

job_title: Operations in San Francisco, CA
pros:
1. Mission of the organization
2. The people you work with are passionate about the community
3. Organization that strives to do the right things such as DEI
cons:
1. Need better internal communications
2. Can build more relationships with sister health plans in CA

job_title: Specialist in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Decent work culture 
Decent Managers 
People seem to care
cons: Overall happiness has declined since COVID. Lots of resignations. Budgets need to be re-examined. Lots of unnecessary spending. The money would be better served paying competitive salaries. Some leadership live in a fictional state of being. Unrealistic workloads where more and more is piled on top.

review_title: A great place to start your career!
job_title: Care Management Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros:
- You will never work with as many talented and incredible people as you do on the Care Management team. The dedication is evident in everyone's personality and devotion.
-The company itself is a solid blend of for profit/public health so you get the perks of corporate life like work from home, "perk" benefits, and fun office events (during non-pandemic times)
- The office is near major transit hubs!
- The onboarding process is very smooth 
- You can network and make great connections here
- The pay was very competitive
cons:
- Sometimes upper management is very disconnected from the daily going on of lower-ranking employees. This creates miscommunication about tasks and workflows which can feel tedious to communicate again and again
- The corporate atmosphere can be disheartening for those who are not suited for it
- the work load can be HEAVY at times, especially during audit season

job_title: Specialist in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great benefits including plenty of PTO. Good work life balance.
cons: Path to promotions can be unclear and favorites seem to exist here.

review_title: Awesome supervisors but strapped for people
job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Current super visors are awesome and positive and really try to make sure you are good
cons: There is a lot to learn quickly and there's no central place for you to find direct answers to questions that are up to date . Conflicting responses to the same issues makes it difficult to provide the right information and when you give the wrong information you are lightly scolded and told to read training material that has no central repository. Customer service takes on a lot of duties and other departments push back on helping or drop the ball . There is a lot to do on the customer service side and not enough bodies to make things run smoother .

review_title: Company is really good and flexible.
job_title: Senior QA Analyst in San Francisco, CA
pros: Diverse and people are really good
cons: Salaries are not that great.

job_title: Program Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: They really hear what your opinions are and make sure they accommodate.
cons: Still seeking faster growth and promotion. This varies depending on the department and team.

review_title: If you are just needing a job
job_title: Management in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good benefits, positive pension plan, PTO
cons: HR is keeping this company from being great! Undermines departments and managers regularly. The reputation in this department is known by everyone and keeping SFHP from being a great place to work. They're out of touch with the rest of the organization.

review_title: Genuine, caring people working to support our community
job_title: Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: The nicest group of people I have ever worked with. People are supportive, friendly, and fun, and teamwork is really emphasized. The mission shines through every day-- we are all working to help our community. In other companies I sometimes felt a tension between making a profit and doing what was right for our users/customers, but I have never felt that here. Challenging problems to solve and stretch your brain and a lot of opportunity to think big. Excellent work life balance-- management supports people and encourages time off.
cons: It's healthcare + government, so there are regulations and bureaucracy that can be frustrating. But if you are creative and persistent you can find ways to still make things work.

review_title: Good work, great people, could evolve
job_title: Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great people, excellent mission, humble and transparent CEO
cons: Older style of management, favoritism, some lip service

job_title: Analyst in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great PTO, leadership, diversity, culture
cons: No holiday parties, gifts, small wellness benefit

job_title: Care Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: paid fairly, good benefits, good stepping stone job.
cons: PTO is combined w/ sick days, hard to move up w/o a masters

review_title: Great environment, depending on the team you're on
job_title: Program Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Mission of the organization and lifetime benefits
cons: Not alot of people of color at the top of the organization, not all teams are supportive

review_title: great community, everyone there is super helpful!
job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in San Francisco, CA
pros: health benefits, PTO, training is really good
cons: hard to move up quickly

job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: New management and change is happening
cons: There is no flexibility in adjusting your schedule.

job_title: Product Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: amazing teammates, some of the most mission-driven people!
cons: lots of processes can slow the work.

job_title: EMT in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great people and great pay
cons: Working holidays makes for a tough schedule

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in San Francisco, CA
pros: SFHP provides good benefits including medical,dental, vision
cons: NO 401k, SSN contribution and very social events.

job_title: Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros:
-company is growing rapidly
-work culture is positive; lots of humor; non-profit altruistic work culture
-great dinosaur of a pension plan and good benefits
-near BART
-mission focused with employees who believe the work they do matters for the population we serve
-fast pace/ dynamic work environment
-company has strong financial health
-Women of Color in management/c-suites
-HEDIS Gold award winning for six years in a row (2007-2013)
-dominate San Francisco Medi-Cal market as the local initiative plan; serving 17% of SF population with its various programs and reached 100,000 members in April 2014
cons:
-employee retention is a company goal because salary is not competitive, difficult for early career professionals to obtain promotions/leadership roles, veteran employees deal with organizational barriers that systematically prevent job satisfaction (e.g. lack of autonomy for decisions, home grown systems that solve immediate problems but not sustainable, constant “put out fires” approach vs. prevention)
-rapid company growth has required management to invest in how the company is structured to improve business processes; the institutional change they are fostering takes time to implement and the rapid industry changes coupled with the internal changes makes this growth period a challenging work environment

job_title: Senior Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Smart, hard-working co-workers
Executive leadership cares about how they are perceived by employees 
Lots of opportunity for learning and developing skills
Many departments have positive feeling; employees happy/positive in most departments 
Hard work, innovation rewarded in most departments 
Executive Team stable 
Strong, positive Directors team has emerged in the past 3 years
Managers in most departments given a lot of support and training
SFHP's policies are congruent with the mission of the organization: leadership and associates genuinely care about the welfare of Medi-Cal recipients in SF County
cons: During periods of rapid expansion, I have seen some leaders communicate in ways that are damaging to the culture--blaming, pointing fingers, etc. Unfortunately, that has resulted in a loss of some talent. However, I have observed that both the Executive Team and Directors Team have put a lot of energy into changing the organizational culture by learning to model collegial, productive communication to the managers and associates.

job_title: Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good Financial District location close to Bart, shopping and dining. Company says the right things and maybe is even trying to do the right things but it doesn't always hit the mark. Depending on your department, there are some nice people. Some flexibility to work from home but limited to 1 day per week depending on your manager. Company seems to be doing well financially.
cons: Company tries to act like a startup in culture but it falls flat. Company is between a small company and a midsized so they try to create that young hip vibe but the work isn't cool and the people don't embrace that culture.  Picture your grandparents trying to be cool. Can be a tough place to work depending on your department.  Not everyone works equally hard or held to same standards even though that's what they preach. Can feel phony.

job_title: Complex Medical Case Management RN in San Francisco, CA
pros: Once this was a tiny, field based position with expert clinicians in the fields of mental health and medical health.
cons:
Medical/clinical support and supervision evaporated.
Social worker now supervises nurses. Not ok, at all.
Nursing profession treated like joke by social workers. 

They went from CMCM w a 15 case max to  now wanting 1 nurse to carry 150 cases for half the salary.

RUN don't walk

job_title: Customer Service in San Francisco, CA
pros: SFHP has a good mission focusing on the health and welfare of underserved populations, ergo mostly attracting the types of personnel who care about others.
cons: There is a cult-like vibe where everyone has to be pretty much on the same page of better health outcomes, but having to working better, faster and incurring less and less money which is stressful.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: None. If you want to experience how noncompetitive executives run the IT department, this is the place
cons: IT department is run by non IT executive. They have no clue how IT works. No Vision, No direction, No roadmap. Operating on day to day basis. All focus on people management. Never saw CTO focussing that much on people management. I do not approve CTO as CTO material. She acts more like a supervisor. Management by intimidation.

review_title: Disappointing. Worsened over multiple senior management changes.Incompetent IT mgrs.Became a body shop.
job_title: IT Worker in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great mission doing great work to help provide safety net healthcare. Very proud of that.
cons: IT became a body shop; should just offshore because the staff/contractors hired knew nothing about healthcare, or certainly not american healthcare. Hurts analysis efforts and caused loss of credibiliy on the business side.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
This is the most transparent organization I’ve worked at. You’ll know what’s going on through regular all-staff meetings and ongoing updates on important company initiatives. 
You’ll also know why what you do is important. It starts when you join the company. The CEO is unique and special:   he spends time with every new employee explaining the business and getting to know you. 
This is a place that tries to make employees happy. Great training and generous benefits.
cons: Can be a bit bureaucratic because of regulatory requirements on the business.

review_title: Unhealthy place to work, good cause to work for. What a shame
job_title: IT Worker in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good mission: To provide healthcare for the healthcare safety net
cons: Management disorganized.  Too many managers (ie. people with a job tile that includes manager such as project managers)  whose purpose is mainly to promote themselves.  Not enough people who actually do the work.  .   Management is  by intimidation.  If you value a healthy work environment, this is not it.  Very dysfunctional organization.

job_title: Program Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Interview process is streamlined, everyone is very accommodating.  Interview itself is not tricky, but it's important that you know your stuff. Work environment is friendly and welcoming, everyone seems very interested in the mission of the organization and dedicated to public service. Bonus, the employer qualifies for Public Service Federal Student Loan forgiveness program.
cons: Open floor plan, which is really popular, but IMO not really conducive to productivity. Pay is commiserate with non-profits, but reasonable.

job_title: in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Community-based 
Non-profit 
Great mission
Still a small enough organization that allows for quick decision-making
Very diverse group of employees that understand the organizations main customers
cons:
Relatively young organization that is going through some growing pains
Government-sponsored programs with heavy restrictions and short deadlines make prioritizing difficult

review_title: Great cause and benefits. Poor executive leadership.
job_title: Project Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: The health care benefits are great. The CalPERS 457 Pension program is good too.
cons: Executive leadership distrusts senior managers. There is nearly constant turn-around at the upper levels, except where it's needed most: the CEO position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: SFHP is a company that truly lives by its mission statement. The aim of the organization as a whole is to provide all San Francisco residents with the health care coverage they need.
cons: My only con for working at SFHP is that I have to commute into the city from the East Bay. The office is located very close to the Embarcadero BART station.

review_title: Join if you just need a paycheck and desperate for a job
job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros:
- Generous amount of PTOs, pension and health benefits
- Close distance to Bart
- Work here as long as you want. Unless you have really poor performance, otherwise you won't get fired
cons:
- No career development, well *maybe* if you worked there for over 10 years then you can eventually become a manager or supervisor. Favoritism over performance.
- Office politics (pretty much everywhere)
- Micro-management, especially in the Customer Service department 
- Hostile working environment

job_title: Announcer in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great benefits and staff to work with
cons: Management pretends to be supportive but they showed the contrary when there is something that doesn’t go their way. Unreasonable expectations and among management and supervisors they covered each other

job_title: Customer Service Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros:
-Unlike the Representatives, I get to leave my desk whenever if I have to.
-Entry level job that is easy to learn. 
-Training not as extensive as the Representatives.
cons: -Can get a bit repetitive if you have no other projects to work on.

review_title: Great health care benefits and personable staff. Positive mission, but questionable executive leadership
job_title: Project Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Health Care benefits, CalPers 457 pension, other "standard" benefits
cons: Compensation is par at best. No one trusts the CEO.

job_title: Finance Specialist in San Francisco, CA
pros: excellent benefits, generous PTO, great location and environment
cons: Work environment is fun and hard-working - but also very meeting heavy so staying organized is important.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Mission is good and the benefits are good. There are a lot of great people who are smart and want to contribute to the mission.
cons: Most of the executives are challenging and it seems like a lot of people in the organization know that the executives have issues with each other.

review_title: Great place to work, friendly staff, great management
job_title: Project Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Management empowers individual staff members, goal-setting, staff encouraged to be involved in different projects, values your voice no matter what status you are
cons: Temp employees are not invited to work functions

job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Super benefits, generous PTO. People are amazing, very positive and supporting.
cons: Hard to get a promotion, there are many unspoken rules. I would say it reminds me about government job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: great benefits and coworkers, convenient location near all kinds of public transportation, mission-driven organization helping marginalized San Franciscans
cons: Some upper management out of touch with what's going on with members, slow to adopt change, employee burnout, not enough attention paid to health plan interventions/outreach to improve public health

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Work/Life Balance is good. Colleagues are friendly.
cons: Some teams have a pretty flexible work culture and some don't. It all depends on the team.  A very conservative work culture and promotions don't depend on your performance necessarily.

review_title: Growing Company Operating as a Small Business
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good benefits, close proximity to BART and Muni, Nice People.
cons: Poor leadership, very low compensation, lack of organization, very high turnover

job_title: Operations in San Francisco, CA
pros: Pay and benefits package are top-notch, great growth potential, coworkers are very knowledgeable and skilled. Also, the office is very inviting, modern, and centrally located.
cons: Sometimes I feel like SFHP is still in the growing stages and still operates somewhat like a start-up.

job_title: Project Manager in Oakland, CA
pros: rapidly growing and many new programs; making a difference with the underserved populations in san francisco
cons: mediocre management; strategic priorities are valid but lacking planning and evaluation of initiatives

review_title: Management Needs To Listen More and Talk Less
job_title: I T in San Francisco, CA
pros: SFHP's mission is awesome. The employees with tenure are truly dedicated to improving healthcare for the residents of San Francisco.
cons: Pay is not comparable to market. Management is under qualified and changes direction too often which creates dissonance.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Good Work life balance.
Good benefits
cons: Low pay per bay area standards

review_title: This place is not good c

job_title: Customer Service Representative in San Francisco, CA

job_title: Team Lead in San Francisco, CA

job_title: Member Eligibility Coordinator in San Francisco, CA

job_title: Project Manager in San Francisco, CA

job_title: Administrative in San Francisco, CA
